definition: shortcoming/defect/fault/one's weak points
short/brief/to lack/weak point/fault
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: People often build their identity around their defects.
sentences.chinese: 人往往將自我的身分建立在他們的短處上。

sentences.english: Gollan believes this deficit can becompensated for with extra study.
sentences.chinese: 高蘭認爲這個短處可以通過額外學習的方式來補足。

sentences.english: Every archetype has strengths, weaknesses, gifts, and fears.
sentences.chinese: 每一個原型都有自己的長處，短處，天性，和恐懼。

sentences.english: Pluses and minuses to both vehicles but I am attracted by the more luxurious interior of the QX.
sentences.chinese: 兩個長處和短處車，但我吸引更豪華的室內QX。

sentences.english: Howells is fully aware of Bartley's failings.
sentences.chinese: 豪威爾斯是完全清楚巴特勒的短處的。

sentences.english: Professor Weinberger recognizes the strengths and weaknesses of his site.
sentences.chinese: 溫伯格教授承認，他的網站的長處和短處。

sentences.english: As far as I am concerned, the advantages mentioned above exceed the disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 至於我的看法是，上面提到的長處超過短處。

sentences.english: She likes to show people up in public.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡在衆人前揭人的短處。

sentences.english: What are your strengths and weaknesses in hiring?
sentences.chinese: 在聘用方面，你的長處和短處分別是什麼？

definition: to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to dispute/to refute
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
magnanimous
priceless treasure
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to be strict with oneself
to play deaf-mute
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
